Legacy Document

Important: The information in this document is obsolete and should not be used for new development.

Inside Macintosh: Networking /
Chapter 2 - AppleTalk Utilities / AppleTalk Utilities Reference
Routines

Obtaining Information About the .MPP Driver and the Current Network Environment

You can use the PGetAppleTalkInfo function to obtain a wide variety of information about the .MPP driver that is installed on the node that is running your application
and the network environment of that node. Among the information that the PGetAppleTalkInfo function returns are

  • the address and zone name of the node that is running your application
  • the number of concurrent NBP calls that the installed .MPP driver supports
  • the range of network numbers for the network, if it is an extended network
